--- title: "Callum Waite" include-after-body: _footer.html --- ### {{< fa circle-user >}} Bio :::{.bio-row} :::{.bio-column-right} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/AtlasOfLivingAustralia/ala-labs/main/images/people/callum.jpg){width=275px style="display:block; margin-left:auto; margin-right:auto; clip-path: circle();"} ::: ::: ::: :::{.bio-column-left} Callum is an ecological data analyst with a Masters in Quantitative Biology. He has a background in population ecology modelling and is passionate about effective and aesthetic data visualisation. As a data analyst with the ALA, he works on projects that support biosecurity and improve data visualisation using ALA data. ::: ::: :::{.column-body style="margin-top:-20px;"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: ### {{< fa newspaper >}} Posts [Combining multiple species distributions on one map with hexagons and points](https://labs.ala.org.au/posts/2024-01-25_hex_point_maps/)
*Visualising multiple species distributions in a single figure can be difficult if there are areas where ranges overlap. In this post we introduce a way to show several species distributions in an area at once using a novel twist on the commonly used hexbin map.*
